inclusion.criterion: Resuscitated out of hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA) patients
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: OHCA patients whose GCS is 8 or less after ROSC
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: intracranial haemorrhage, active bleeding, known terminal illness, or poor pre-arrest neurological status
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: brain computed tomography showed severe cerebral oedema, obliteration of the basal cisterns, occult intracranial mass lesion, antiplatelet therapy, anticoagulation therapy, or coagulopathy: platelet count < 40 x 10^3/mL or international normalized ratio (INR) > 1.5
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: no next of kin to consent to LP
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: refusal of further treatment by the next of kin
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of viral encephalitis/meningitis with residual deficits, which may indicate poor neurological status. Additionally, the patient's cardiac MRI showed a mass in the right atrium adjacent to the AV junction, which could be a contraindication for TTM.
